intro: Cheiranthus dentatus, commonly known as the toothed wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are small, bright yellow, and have four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the family. It produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds.
